page.title: 09Trade in Rogate
page.content: The church which has stood on the same site for 900 years dominates the cross roads ,once it was a very busy shopping area with a cobblers, a beer, a tailors, a blacksmiths, a grocers and a bakers shop. There is still a sign of the beer shop ,an old house called the Red Lion, even the old dame school has been converted into a house. The one shop which has remained is called Rogate Stores with its little Post Office tucked inside where people can get their pensions. It provides a valuable meeting place for village folk besides giving many a passing motorist a chance to do some quick shopping.Unfortunately it is closed at the moment as it has gone bankrupt but probably someone will buy this thriving business.
